course_title: Special Topics: Theatre: Staged Reading Practice
class_notes:
(Same as SPAN 285 2)
(Complete Topic - Staged reading practice: Bodas de sangre by Federico Garcia Lorca)
"Que yo no tengo la culpa, que la culpa es de la tierra."  This interdisciplinary, one-credit course is devoted entirely to Federico Garcia Lorca's famous work, Bodas de Sangre, and coincides with the Theater Emory production of Blood Wedding, translated by Langston Hughes. We will study the play in Spanish, and prepare for a dramatic reading of the text, practicing oral skills, theater techniques, play analysis, and the bringing-to-life of a dramatic story. The course culminates in a public staged reading of the play (scripts in hand), including selections of Lorca's poetry and featuring Flamenco music and dance. We will also attend the Theater Emory production of Blood Wedding and place both texts and both languages in conversation with one another.
Prerequisite: Spanish 212
course_description: Individual courses on special topics in theater at the 200-level. This course may be repeated.
